wheatDiseases.name: Wheat Leaf Rust
wheatDiseases.foundIn: Global, common in warm and humid regions
symptoms: Small, circular, orange to brown pustules on leaves
Pustules may merge, causing extensive leaf damage
Reduced photosynthesis leading to lower yields
prevention: Apply fungicides during early stages of infection
Crop rotation to break pathogen cycle
wheatDiseases.description: Wheat Leaf Rust is a fungal disease that significantly reduces wheat yield. It thrives in warm, moist environments and spreads quickly under favorable conditions.

wheatDiseases.name: Wheat Loose Smut
symptoms: Black, powdery masses replacing the grain in the wheat head
prevention: Treat seeds with fungicides before planting
wheatDiseases.description: Wheat Loose Smut is a seed-borne fungal disease. It infects the wheat plant during flowering and produces dark spore masses in place of grains.

wheatDiseases.name: Wheat Powdery Mildew
symptoms: White, powdery fungal growth on leaves, stems, and heads
prevention: Apply fungicides at the first sign of infection
wheatDiseases.description: Wheat Powdery Mildew is a common fungal disease affecting wheat foliage and stems. It thrives in cool, humid conditions.

wheatDiseases.name: Wheat Septoria Leaf Blotch
symptoms: Irregular brown lesions with yellow halos on leaves
Small black fruiting bodies within lesions
prevention: Rotate crops to prevent pathogen buildup
Apply fungicides during critical growth stages
wheatDiseases.description: Wheat Septoria Leaf Blotch is a foliar disease that causes significant yield losses. It spreads via rain splash and thrives in wet conditions.

wheatDiseases.name: Fusarium Head Blight (FHB)
wheatDiseases.foundIn: Global, especially in wet and warm climates
symptoms: Bleached spikelets with pink or orange fungal growth
prevention: Avoid planting wheat in fields with maize residue
wheatDiseases.description: Fusarium Head Blight is a devastating disease of wheat, affecting grain quality and safety due to mycotoxin contamination.
